title: Origins to Spotlight
description: A straight-line rise from the first rooms to the biggest stages.
tone: Measured, human-centered reporting with reflective edges (Jesse Washington cut)
openingLine: A sound crossed oceans and settled into Seattle by 2012.
closingLine: The movement keeps writing its next chapter.

anecdote.title: First Afrobeats Night at The Crocodile
anecdote.story: The energy was electric. DJ Khaled was spinning Wizkid and Davido tracks, and the dance floor was packed from wall to wall.
anecdote.notes: This event marked the beginning of the Seattle Afrobeats scene.
anecdote._text: first afrobeats night at the crocodile the energy was electric. dj khaled was spinning wizkid and davido tracks, and the dance floor was packed from wall to wall. this event marked the beginning of the seattle afrobeats scene. the crocodile, belltown amara johnson milestone dj dance

anecdote.title: Wizkid's First Seattle Performance
anecdote.story: When Wizkid stepped on stage at Showbox SoDo, the crowd went wild. He performed 'Ojuelegba' and 'Come Closer'.
anecdote._text: wizkid's first seattle performance when wizkid stepped on stage at showbox sodo, the crowd went wild. he performed 'ojuelegba' and 'come closer'. tickets sold out in 2 hours. showbox sodo tunde olatunji concert wizkid nigeria

beats.summary: When Wizkid stepped on stage at Showbox SoDo, the crowd went wild. He performed 'Ojuelegba' and 'Come Closer'.
beats.voiceover: Tunde Olatunji remembers wizkid's first seattle performance. When Wizkid stepped on stage at Showbox SoDo, the crowd went wild. He performed 'Ojuelegba' and 'Come Closer'.

anecdote.title: Afrobeats Dance Workshop at UW
anecdote.story: We organized a free dance workshop teaching Azonto and Shaku Shaku moves. Over 200 people showed up!
anecdote.notes: Co-hosted by the African Student Association.
anecdote._text: afrobeats dance workshop at uw we organized a free dance workshop teaching azonto and shaku shaku moves. over 200 people showed up! co-hosted by the african student association. university of washington chioma nwosu dance workshop education

beats.summary: We organized a free dance workshop teaching Azonto and Shaku Shaku moves. Over 200 people showed up!
beats.voiceover: By 2019, the story is no longer about a moment but a movement.
